Contribute to Reponcentric

We welcome contributions from everyone! Whether you're a student, researcher, academic, or industry professional, your insights and expertise can help improve this open-source academic roadmap.

Remember: This is an open-source project. Everyone is encouraged to share their thoughts, add new content, update existing materials, and suggest improvements.

How to Contribute

  1. Fork the repository on GitHub to create your own copy.
  2. Make your changes by adding new notes, updating existing content, or fixing errors.
  3. Submit a pull request with a clear description of your contributions.
  4. Engage in discussions through issues and comments to refine ideas.

Types of Contributions

  • Content Creation: Write new notes, case studies, or research summaries.
  • Content Updates: Improve existing materials with new information or corrections.
  • Research: Add links to relevant studies, articles, or resources.
  • Discussion Questions: Create thought-provoking questions for each unit.
  • Translations: Help make the content accessible in multiple languages.
  • Feedback: Share your thoughts on the structure, content, or usability.

Guidelines

  • Use clear, concise language accessible to students at various levels.
  • Cite sources when referencing research or theories.
  • Maintain a neutral, academic tone.
  • Ensure content is original or properly attributed.
  • Follow the existing file structure and naming conventions.

Get Started

Ready to contribute? Visit our GitHub repository and start exploring. If you have questions, feel free to open an issue or join our community discussions.

Every contribution, no matter how small, helps build a better resource for learners worldwide. Thank you for your interest in making education more accessible!
